Posts.Title: Joined the Club

Posts.Content: I'm 52 I will not screw around at all. I am ready to have surgery next week if possible. I have a saying "I want to go to heaven just not today". I think my urologist will do the surgery he's my primary care dr's urologist and I trust him. I am in a panic I'm just hoping and praying that the tumor is still in my prostate and has not metastasized. Thank you for the words of engorgement. Good luck and prayers to of of you as well.

Posts.Title: Great news

Posts.Content: I had surgery last Monday 8-26-13 I was under for 8 hours because there was a fly in the operating room and caused a 2 hour delay. I also had umbilical hernia surgery after the prostatecomy. The catheter came out 9-3-13 and I hated it the hole time it was in I am not a difficult person and tried to be fair with it but my body started to reject it immediately, this is my second full day without it. I used 3 pads and a diaper yesterday but I was pretty inactive, I only went for one 1.5 mile walk. Today I have been more active as my wife is home and forcing me to be. I have went thru one pad and the second one is damp but not wet. I am doing well so far I think. Yesterday I was really down on myself because I was like a leaky Lucy and whizzing every time I got up to walk. Today is much better. I do have a question every time I feel myself leak I do a kegel I am wondering if this is normal and am I supposed to let some leaking happen? Thank you Krugzz
